entry.title: Pulitzer Prize–winning photograph (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after he waited twenty-four hours to capture his Pulitzer Prize–winning photograph (pictured), the flash bulb on Earle Bunker's camera failed on his first attempt?

entry.title: Fred G. Sullivan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fred G. Sullivan's film The Beer-Drinker's Guide to Fitness and Filmmaking depicts Sullivan being humiliated with mud and whips for the failings of his previous film?

entry.title: 3rd-century treatise on vegetarianism (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Porphyry describes a moral obligation to extend justice to animals in his 3rd-century treatise on vegetarianism?

entry.title: Yuna Kim had a major impact on figure skating (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Yuna Kim had a major impact on figure skating and was instrumental in bringing the Olympics to Pyeongchang in 2018?

entry.title: Winsted Citizen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2023, Ralph Nader founded the newspaper Winsted Citizen in his hometown of Winsted, Connecticut, where he delivered papers as a boy?

entry.title: Concha Liaño (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after fleeing the Spanish Civil War to Venezuela, Spanish anarchist Concha Liaño became a supporter of Hugo Chávez?

entry.title: 1940 New Zealand coin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that two rival designers independently submitted a map for the design of a 1940 New Zealand coin?

entry.title: "Cave Man Kenny" (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Cave Man Kenny" was a "fast-charging, hard-hitting" "ubiquitous" "obstreperous iron man" with "dependable shoulders"?
